title: I think it's funny how the really old mouses are now "gaming mouses"?
body: Now when I say "old" I'm talking about really simple mouses. The ones that have just the left and right buttons and the wheel in the middle (not the ones with a million buttons on them, and not the wireless ones either). Anyways, about a month ago I was out shopping for a new mouse because my old one wasn't working properly. I told them I was looking for a gaming mouse, and the mouses they showed me didn't look fancy at all. Just the left and right buttons and the wheel (and the cord attached to it, not the wireless ones). Now you'd think that these simple mouses (no new technology or anything) would be the cheaper ones. But no, apparently these "fancy gaming mouses" are the most expensive. I find it hilarious that stores charge you more for a piece of outdated technology.
